body:
some idea for the integration part:
* It is not only to integrate the DQ checking/validation action into the orginal data pipeline, but also to have an option to have the validation as mandatory. 
* besides the mutli-dimentional dq result, there should be more option to define what is a dq failure so that the failure will cause the original data pipeline failure
* dq failure could be defined as per dimentional, also could be defined based on a Reducer Function, for example, in the simplest way, a default weighted average function would be good enough to start.
would it be better to have this as v2?

> some idea for the integration part:
> 
> * It is not only to integrate the DQ checking/validation action into the orginal data pipeline, but also to have an option to have the validation as mandatory.
> * besides the mutli-dimentional dq result, there should be more option to define what is a dq failure so that the failure will cause the original data pipeline failure
> * dq failure could be defined as per dimentional, also could be defined based on a Reducer Function, for example, in the simplest way, a default weighted average function would be good enough to start.

data quality standard in the first layer should cover all these details, 
reduce(dq_result(dimension_1), dq_result(dimension_2),...)  -> DQ_Result

> @guoyuepeng ,
> 
> As the change we are dicussing is a great one, could you give more clarifications here?
> 
> I mean you can give a high level diagram to make clear of what to do/not to do in the new architecture. I think everyone in Griffin community needs to get to the same page.

yes, I will initialize this part.

> would it be better to have this as v2?

not a problem for me.

Seems the proposed architecture will be very scalable. I think we can first determine the main interfaces and make the whole process run smoothly based on the existing features (MySQL datasource, SQL rule and accuracy dimension with quartz scheduler). Other extensions like more data sources and UDF support can be determined later. 

I suggest to draft a detailed proposal on Google Docs or some other platforms, just like [FLIP](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/FLINK/FLIP+Template). Once it's finalized, we can develop the modules separately.

> Seems the proposed architecture will be very scalable. I think we can first determine the main interfaces and make the whole process run smoothly based on the existing features (MySQL datasource, SQL rule and accuracy dimension with quartz scheduler). Other extensions like more data sources and UDF support can be determined later.
> 
> I suggest to draft a detailed proposal on Google Docs or some other platforms, just like [FLIP](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/FLINK/FLIP+Template). Once it's finalized, we can develop the modules separately.

yes, that's good idea, we will do it.

> Seems the proposed architecture will be very scalable. I think we can first determine the main interfaces and make the whole process run smoothly based on the existing features (MySQL datasource, SQL rule and accuracy dimension with quartz scheduler). Other extensions like more data sources and UDF support can be determined later.
> 
> I suggest to draft a detailed proposal on Google Docs or some other platforms, just like [FLIP](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/FLINK/FLIP+Template). Once it's finalized, we can develop the modules separately.

https://github.com/apache/griffin/blob/master/griffin-doc/dev/griffin-pip.md
I wrote something for this a while back.
init DQDiagrams doc

> > Seems the proposed architecture will be very scalable. I think we can first determine the main interfaces and make the whole process run smoothly based on the existing features (MySQL datasource, SQL rule and accuracy dimension with quartz scheduler). Other extensions like more data sources and UDF support can be determined later.
> > I suggest to draft a detailed proposal on Google Docs or some other platforms, just like [FLIP](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/FLINK/FLIP+Template). Once it's finalized, we can develop the modules separately.
> 
> yes, that's good idea, we will do it.

After we finalize the design, we can work a plan to implement it.
I have changed the target branch.

Thanks, @guoyuepeng .

I'll follow this thesis and complete the whole pom structure.

Jin

@guoyuepeng,

the 2.0.0 pom structure has been revised and passed the compiling, could you review it?

i will update metric module this week.
I am not familiar with the previous checkstyle configuration, but I wonder if we can introduce the spotless plugin to automatically format the code, xml and markdown files?
@whhe , Could you review this change.
LGTM
@guoyuepeng , Can you review my update on your change?

> @guoyuepeng , Can you review my update on your change?

when users want to publish metric value, we might also attach tags in the coming metric value?
should we update this part in metricv?

> > @guoyuepeng , Can you review my update on your change?
> 
> when users want to publish metric value, we might also attach tags in the coming metric value? should we update this part in metricv?

Good point.
@guoyuepeng I have added tag property into metricV entity, and complemented java doc.
LGTM, merged to griffin-2.0.0-dev.

hi everyone,

Could you have a check and work on this DAO service, I will work on Data Quality Workflow module.

@toyboxman 

Thanks.

All in all, the persistence skeleton looks good to me.

let's merge firstly and complement in following changes.

Again, what's JDK version do we prefer?  8, 11 , 17, or others, looks like spring boot latest support higher JDK.

Now in this PR, we simply include metric entity, yet workflow job still needs to be considered.
ok, I will merge it and we can improve it step by step...
cool, maybe we can rename this module as some kind of DAO module, and separate common model into common module.

there are conflicts, could you fix it first?
@toyboxman

and this is local mode, flexible and programmatically way.

for high volume mode, we can abstract the workflow based on spring cloud data flow, and leverage spring cloud to schedule our cloud native tasks.
